event.title: became the Honiton to Axminster Turnpike in 1765

data.event: It became the Honiton to Axminster Turnpike in 1765 but the importance of this route diminished when the Upottery to Ilminster turnpike opened in 1807 which led to a steady improvement in coaching facilities in the early 19th century on what is now the A30/A303 route over the Blackdown Hills from Honiton to Ilminster.

It became the Honiton to Axminster Turnpike in 1765 but the importance of this route diminished when the Upottery to Ilminster turnpike opened in 1807 which led to a steady improvement in coaching facilities in the early 19th century on what is now the A30/A303 route over the Blackdown Hills from Honiton to Ilminster.

event.title: 1805 the village street rang to the clatter of horses hooves as messengers raced

data.event: In 1805 the village street rang to the clatter of horses hooves as messengers raced through with news of the Battle of Trafalgar.
In 2005 this historic event was marked by the unveiling of this plaque on the White Hart Inn.
